title: Probability Rules
text: To find the probability of this situation, we first have to find out the total number of occurrences in which someone is driving. AKA, we want to know how many non-cell phone drivers there are.

title: Total Drivers
text: How many total non-cell phone drivers are there?

title: Probability Rules
text: After getting the total number of drivers, we just need to find the total number of people who fulfill our original requirement. AKA, how many people have had no tickets in the past year.

title: Total Phone Users
text: How many drivers have had no tickets in the past year given that they are not a cell phone user?

title: Answer
text: Now that we have our proportions set up, we can divide the "non-phone" drivers by the number of total drivers to get our final probability. What is our final answer?
